Articles.Content:
Hello all, and happy 4th of July.

Just very very very recently started playing ksp although I have watched hundreds of hours. I've been collecting a neat little group of mods together but I cannot get science alerts to work at all. I've had a very quick look at ckan and it looks very lackluster and lacking the mods I'm after. If anyone has any tips/advice on the matter it would be appreciated.

Thanks,

17 minutes ago, 4ngu5 said:

Hello all, and happy 4th of July.

Just very very very recently started playing ksp although I have watched hundreds of hours. I've been collecting a neat little group of mods together but I cannot get science alerts to work at all. I've had a very quick look at ckan and it looks very lackluster and lacking the mods I'm after. If anyone has any tips/advice on the matter it would be appreciated.

Thanks,

In general CKAN doesn't have newer or uncommon mods. However it is great for mods with many dependencies (installing visual packs is easy cause you don't have to install 30 mods manually.) I recommend using both CKAN and manual. Use CKAN for what it does have and manual for what it doesn't.

Are you playing in sandbox mode? It probably won't work in that mode as science is irrelevant. For science/career modes, make sure you have all the dependencies and are on the right versions- try uninstalling and reinstalling it. If that doesn't help check the in-game settings for the mod, maybe you need to change some of those.

CKAN doesn't have everything, some by choice and some by necessity, but it has the majority of mods on it and has version and dependency controls so you don't have to find the right versions and all the dependencies yourself.
